channel.title: Respawn area?
channel.description: I want to know where do i change where my players are when they log in and where they respawn on death.

item.title: Respawn area?
item.dc:creator: @Vince2 Vince,
item.description:
@Vince2 wrote:

Good, just be sure to search next time, helps keep spam at a minimum.

Read full topic

item.title: Respawn area?
item.dc:creator: @frostyboy07 frostyboy07
item.description:
@frostyboy07 wrote:

Well I went through and changed my starting and re-spawning coordinates using my server, based from delta, lol. If it is incorrect them i’m sorry, but it worked for me.

Read full topic

item.title: Respawn area?
item.dc:creator: @Vince2 Vince,
item.description:
@Vince2 wrote:

[quote=“frostyboy07, post:4, topic:364021”]To change starting co-ordinates for a new player, make a new acc named test or soemthing, log in, and DON’t move! Type ::mypos or ::coords , go to Player.java, push ctrl+f and search for the X coord you were given after typing ::mypos. Now go to where you want the starting position to be, type ::mypos again, and change the coords to that.

To change death re-spawn area, simply kill yourself, when you die DON’T move and again type ::mypos, search for the X coord in Client.java and again, change the coords.

NOTE: BOTH OF THESE ARE SERVER SIDED[/quote]
Not 100% correct. Ever since Delta was released, people have been using +misc.random(), so it could be random coords.

Read full topic

item.title: Respawn area?
item.dc:creator: @frostyboy07 frostyboy07
item.description:
@frostyboy07 wrote:

To change starting co-ordinates for a new player, make a new acc named test or soemthing, log in, and DON’t move! Type ::mypos or ::coords , go to Player.java, push ctrl+f and search for the X coord you were given after typing ::mypos. Now go to where you want the starting position to be, type ::mypos again, and change the coords to that.

To change death re-spawn area, simply kill yourself, when you die DON’T move and again type ::mypos, search for the X coord in Client.java and again, change the coords.

NOTE: BOTH OF THESE ARE SERVER SIDED

Read full topic
